definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

pinyin: xuan2 zhuan3 xing2 li5 chuan2 song4 dai4

sentences.english: Experienced professionals want to transition to the career of their dreams.
sentences.chinese: 久经历练的老手希望转行做自己梦想的工作。

sentences.english: There are many career change assessments available to help you with career change advice.
sentences.chinese: 有不少转行评估可以用来帮助你改变职业咨询。

sentences.english: After a couple of years, Ross grew bored with TACT and went into finance instead.
sentences.chinese: 几年之后，罗斯厌倦了TACT并转行金融工作。

sentences.english: Technology people may try to transfer to another business field in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 从事技术的向其它业务领域转行风已兴起。

sentences.english: Change the game, usually by redefining the segment you are playing in.
sentences.chinese: 转行，通常的做法就是重新定义所处的行业细分市场。

sentences.english: One of the strangest miscalculations afoot in the land is a bias against career changers.
sentences.chinese: 最奇怪的事情之一就是许多人对于转行的人有偏见。

sentences.english: Career change can sometimes be an expensive proposition.
sentences.chinese: 有时转行可能是一个昂贵的议题。

definition: switch to a job one was not trained for
to fight in one place after another
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
to go for/to engage in/to undertake/to deal with/to handle/to do
